title: Please provide pdiffs for Translation files

sentences.text: I read a few days back and was glad to know about your Description less Packages file [1] and wanted to know if there is a way or are going to be ways so that we could have pdiffs for the translations when we are updating the aptitude index as we have do for others.
If I understand the idea correctly what it would do is that those users who do not want/or need english descriptions of packages would not get any hence saving bandwidth and hdd as well.
The problem is that this change comes along with a slight bandwidth spike of its own.
As of right now everytime I run
I get something along these lines :-
Please see lines 44 and line 45 specifically
Now as can be seen the pdiff is fine just in some bytes but for Translation each time it downloads the full file.
This is same for unstable, testing as well as for experimental with experimental being the smallest update each time but is still significant.
Before this change index updation use to be between 500 to 800 KB of change, now its around 9-11 MB per index update :-
I do not know whom to approach this, whether you have to do something or the aptitude people or somebody else somewhere else.
Please let me know if I need to take it up with somebody else.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
Versions of packages aptitude depends on:
My quotes in this email licensed under CC 3.0
I tell you more: testing now downloads all translations ^_^.

> I read a few days back and was glad to know about your Description > less Packages file [1] and wanted to know if there is a way or are > going to be ways so that we could have pdiffs for the translations > when we are updating the aptitude index as we have do for others.
> If I understand the idea correctly what it would do is that those > users who do not want/or need english descriptions of packages would > not get any hence saving bandwidth and hdd as well.
The problem is > that this change comes along with a slight bandwidth spike of its own.
> As of right now everytime I run
> I get something along these lines :-
> Please see lines 44 and line 45 specifically
> Now as can be seen the pdiff is fine just in some bytes but for > Translation each time it downloads the full file.
This is same for > unstable, testing as well as for experimental with experimental being > the smallest update each time but is still significant.
> Before this change index updation use to be between 500 to 800 KB of > change, now its around 9-11 MB per index update :-
> I do not know whom to approach this, whether you have to do something > or the aptitude people or somebody else somewhere else.
Please let me > know if I need to take it up with somebody else.
> Looking forward to hearing from  you.
> Versions of packages aptitude depends on:
>   My quotes in this email licensed under CC 3.0
retitle 657902 apt: Please make use of pdiffs for Translation files, once available clone 657902 -1
retitle -1 Please provide pdiffs for Translation files

Fixing this problem requires two changes: ftp.debian.org needs to provide pdiffs for the Translation files (since they represent a significant fraction of the previous Packages file size), and apt needs to use those pdiffs once available.
